indentation.description: All bash scripts should use 2 spaces for indentation to maintain consistent code appearance.

error_handling.description: Always handle errors and use appropriate exit codes to ensure robust script execution.

variable_naming.description: Use lowercase snake_case for variables and UPPERCASE_WITH_UNDERSCORES for constants.

shellcheck.description: Run shellcheck on all shell scripts to find common bugs and potential issues.

shebang.description: All executable shell scripts must start with #!/bin/bash for consistency.

indentation.description: All Python code should use 4 spaces for indentation to maintain consistent code appearance.

line_length.description: Keep Python lines under 88 characters as per Black standards.

docstrings.description: Use Google-style docstrings for all functions, classes, and modules.

imports.description: Group imports and sort alphabetically (stdlib, third-party, local).

naming.description: Follow PEP 8 naming conventions for all identifiers.

readme.description: README.md must contain all required sections to properly document the project.

scripts.description: All scripts should have a standardized header with name, description, author, and date.

inline_comments.description: Complex logic (more than 5 lines) should be documented with comments explaining the intent.

path_traversal.description: Avoid path traversal vulnerabilities by validating file paths before use.

input_validation.description: Validate all user inputs to prevent unexpected behavior or security issues.

environment_variables.description: Always quote environment variable expansions to prevent word splitting and globbing.

file_permissions.description: Set appropriate file permissions: 755 for executables and 644 for non-executables.

maximum_line_length.description: Keep lines under 100 characters for better readability.

function_length.description: Functions should not exceed 50 lines to promote modularity.

descriptive_variable_names.description: Use descriptive variable names with at least 3 characters (with common exceptions).

commit_message.description: Follow conventional commits format for clear and standardized commit messages.

branch_naming.description: Use descriptive branch names prefixed with the type of change.

no_binary_files.description: Avoid committing binary files to the repository, with exceptions for necessary assets.

validation.description: Ensure all XML plist files are well-formed and valid according to DTD.

indentation.description: Use 4 spaces for indentation in XML/plist files for better readability.

formatting.description: Format Rust code using rustfmt for consistent style.

clippy.description: Run clippy lints at 'warn' level to catch common mistakes and improve code quality.

required_directories.description: Maintain a consistent project structure with required directories.

src_organization.description: The src directory should contain Rust source files for the application.

bcml_organization.description: The bcml directory should contain the Python package for BCML.

docs_organization.description: The docs directory should contain detailed documentation.
